page.title: 07TRANSPORT
page.content: West Meon Station closed 26 years ago. The bus services which replaced the trains have now shrunk to Petersfield-Winchester and Petersfield- Southampton daily services which pass through the village. Children travelling to Petersfield have a coach provided by the Local Authority. A weekly community mini-bus service to Fareham was started in July 1985. The area is desirable to those who can afford to commute to work or to the train at Petersfield by car, and this has greatly enhanced house prices. This factor, plus the lack of local employment, has meant that many move away from the village. Only 15% of mothers and 9% of fathers of children at West Meon School had also attended there.
